original_title: COPE summons Sri Lankan Airlines, Land Reforms Commission, and University Grants Commission
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lankan Airlines, Land Reforms Commission, and University Grants Commission have been summoned before the Committee on Public Business (COP) in the next parliamentary week to follow up on the progress of implementation of the recommendations given by the committee, a statement by the information department said.
Accordingly, the ‘Export Credit Insurance Corporation’ has been called before the COP committee on April 25, 2023.

The Land Reforms Commission has also been called to the COP committee on April 26, and the progress of implementation of the recommendations given in the committee meeting held on October 21, 2022, will be checked there.
Sri Lankan Airlines has been summoned before the COP committee on April 27, and the University Grants Commission has been summoned on April 28.

Meanwhile, the Vocational Training Authority is scheduled to be called before the Committee on May 9, and the progress of implementation of the recommendations given in the COPE Committee meeting held on March 23, 2023, is expected to be investigated. (Colombo/ April 21/2023)
